page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES.
page.content: THE NAME{GLASSARY}IS DERIVED FROM THE GAELIC{GLASAIRIDH}MEANING "GREY PASTURE" AND{KILMICHAEL}MEANING THE "CHURCH OF ST. MICHAEL". ON TOP OF{TOR A BHLARRAIN}THERE ARE REMAINS OF AN OLD WATCH TOWER, USED WHEN THE DANES RAIDED THE WEST COAST OF SCOTLAND. THE CHURCH IN KILMICHAEL-GLASSARY WHICH WAS REBUILT IN ABOUT 1820 STANDS ON THE SITE OF A MEDIAEVAL CHURCH (ABOUT 1560). IN THE CHURCHYARD THERE ARE MANY FINE STONES. SOME ARE LARGE WITH WARRIORS IN LEATHER TUNICS AND OTHERS HAVE DESIGNS OF LEAVES AND BERRIES. MANY TOURISTS VISIT THIS AREA BECAUSE OF ITS MANY ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES. THE WHOLE AREA AROUND KILMICHAEL-GLASSARY HAS MANY CAIRNS, CUP AND RING ROCKS AND STANDING STONES.
